intro: Hieracium conspectum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, and the plant produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium conspectum is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
